content: I understand your point of view. while it is true that the economy and job creation are important, it is also important to recognize that the protection of our natural resources is crucial to the long-term sustainability of our economy and society. ignoring the importance of ecosystems, such as coral reefs, could lead to negative environmental and economic consequences in the future. for instance, the loss of coral reefs has enormous costs, from increased storm damage to the loss of tourism to damage to the fishing industry, which can have serious economic impacts. therefore, it is essential to maintain a balance between economic development and environmental protection, taking into account the long-term benefits and costs of actions.
